title: Gender and age makeup of workers in image

content.question: The gender and age makeup of the workforce shown in Image 2 best illustrates which of the following phenomena in mid-nineteenth-century European society?

choices.label: Working-class families and bourgeois families generally had similar occupational patterns.
Within factories, skilled workers continued to be predominantly male, while women and children continued to perform mostly unskilled factory work.
The development of working-class neighborhoods was characterized by unsanitary living conditions and high levels of crime.
As more women moved into office or clerical jobs, factory ownersâ€™ treatment of female workers improved.

content.answer: Within factories, skilled workers continued to be predominantly male, while women and children continued to perform mostly unskilled factory work.

topic.text: 5.10: Continuity and Change in the Industrial Age

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
